availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Felix C. Jenkins (Marion Co. postmaster and hotel keeper)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, postmaster and hotel keeper. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Jenkins. Father of James Jenkins, Anna Jenkins, Sarah Jenkins, Thomas Jenkins, and Lewis Jenkins. Served as postmaster of Raywick, Marion County, from December 12, 1857 to September 8, 1858. Hotel keeper in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District no. 1, p. 589.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Martin County, Loogootee, p. 401.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, [p. 554 of microfilm] (accessed via Ancestry.com).
